WorkItem.Description:

Comments.Message: Aye, planning to put it in some sort of status bar, eventually.

Could we do something as simple as enable the default status bar on FormMain? Then populate it with a status string that each model should implement? Might need a default say current version of Rawr if the model isn't updated to implement that string. The invalidated calls could then simply update the status string from the model.
I would suggest that we define a specific key in dictionary returned from GetCharacterDisplayCalculationValues that is used for status string.
Does that not fall foul of CalclulationsDisplay SetCalculations which iterates over all DisplayCalculationValues and would fail when it couldn't set the ValueLabels[key] to the Status entry?
What did you put in the status bar? Please just put Overall + each of the subpoints, for now.
The status bar text is model dependant for Enhance I put Dps points, Survivability Points, Overall Points. If a model hasn't implemented the item it displays a default Rawr version text string.
OK, please fix that for v2.2 release. Leave the model-overridable functionality, but default to just Overall + Subpoints.
